intro: Heteropterys rhombifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf huito, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its rhomboid-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Heteropterys rhombifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks.
